content.question: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. <math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table with 5 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “t, in hours.” The heading for row 2 is “P of t, in passengers.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. t is 0. P of t is 0. Column 2. t is 1. P of t is 35. Column 3. t is 3. P of t is 204. Column 4. t is 6. P of t is 600. Column 5. t is 8. P of t is 728."><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="9em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>t</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.45em"></mspace><mtext>(hours)</mtext></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>8</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.45em"></mspace><mtext>(passengers)</mtext></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>35</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>204</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>600</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>728</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math> The number of passengers who have boarded a ship is modeled by the differentiable function <math alttext="P"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the number of hours since boarding began. Values of <math alttext="P of t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for selected values of <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are given in the table above. (a) According to the model, what is the average rate at which passengers board the ship, in passengers per hour, over the time interval <math alttext="1 is less than or equal to t, which is less than or equal to 8"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours?

frqParts.text: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. <math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table with 5 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “t, in hours.” The heading for row 2 is “P of t, in passengers.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. t is 0. P of t is 0. Column 2. t is 1. P of t is 35. Column 3. t is 3. P of t is 204. Column 4. t is 6. P of t is 600. Column 5. t is 8. P of t is 728."><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="9em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>t</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.45em"></mspace><mtext>(hours)</mtext></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>8</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.45em"></mspace><mtext>(passengers)</mtext></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>35</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>204</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>600</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>728</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math> The number of passengers who have boarded a ship is modeled by the differentiable function <math alttext="P"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the number of hours since boarding began. Values of <math alttext="P of t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for selected values of <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are given in the table above. (a) According to the model, what is the average rate at which passengers board the ship, in passengers per hour, over the time interval <math alttext="1 is less than or equal to t, which is less than or equal to 8"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours?

(b) Write <math alttext="P prime of 4.5"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4.5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> as the limit of a difference quotient. Use the data in the table to approximate <math alttext="P prime of 4.5"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4.5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show the computations that lead to your answer.

(c) Must there be a time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for <math alttext="3 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 6"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, at which <math alttext="P of t, equals 500"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>500</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Justify your answer.

(d) The total number of gallons of water used by the passengers on the ship is modeled by the function <math alttext="G"><mstyle><mrow><mi>G</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined by <math alttext="G of t equals, 120 t, times the square root of t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>G</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>120</mn><mi>t</mi><msqrt><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 8"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the number of hours since boarding began. Find <math alttext="G prime of 4"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>G</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the rate at which passengers use water, in gallons per hour, at time <math alttext="t equals 4"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours.

topic.text: 1.16: Working with the Intermediate Value Theorem (IVT)

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
